Vote-casting at the factory, which employs around 5,500 people, began on Thursday evening. Early estimates put voting turnout at 94.4 percent. The results of the ballot were expected around 2300 GMT. The voting slips that have been slipped into the factory's ballot boxes since yesterday are destined to change the country's industrial history, Silvio Berlusconi Sole 24 Ore business paper said in an editorial on Friday.
